I like comparing Lux and Syndra to each other. They feel like opposite characters.

Syndra is dark mage of LoL IMO.

I wouldn't see Syndra as a dark mage,because the only thing dark about her abilities are her orbs.
She is more like a telekinesis mage,as almost all of her abilities are about moving things with her mind(the orbs are merely there so that she always has something to move)

Dark mages are sometimes not about literally darkness, but looking. Darkness and purple are usually related. Black and purple are color of darkness. Which 2 colours Syndra has.

And Im pretty sure she does her telekinetic powers with her W skill. Telekinesis is high likely not the only thing she can do. Spheres are not in her gameplay just because of "clarity problems".

Her W,E and R all use telekinesis.
W holds/throws something
E pushes away
R throws even more stuff at the enemy.
And in the lore she even lets a castle float.

All of these things are typical telekinetic abilities.
Meanwhile the only thing that connects Syndra to darkness is the fact that her abilities are purple&black.
But by that logic we could say that Ryze and Xerath are water mages.

And I don't know how her spheres would be only there for clarity reasons.She has them so that she always has something to manipulate.
It's similar Azir,who has the ability to summon soldiers,because he can't fill the fantasy of a unit commander if he doesn't have units to command.

> R throws even more stuff at the enemy.

It is saying like Lux is also a telekinesis mage because how she throws projectiles too or like saying Taliyah is not an earth mage because she throws rocks with her mind.

Telekinesis mage is never a thing. Many mages can use telekinesis. It is a super generic description which doesn't give a single hint about how a mage works.

It is also possible that Syndra doesn't use typical telekinesis. I mean, she high likely uses her ''dark magic'' to manipulate other materials, so It is not a direct telekinetic power.

In other say, she covers a material with her dark magic, then she bends the dark magic, and material is controlled by her dark magic. Her W in gameplay is exactly this.

She is known for her spheres, not her telekinetic powers. Xerath is not known for his telekinetic powers either, but his arcane magic.

Taliyah,Lux and Annie all use their respective element in all of her skills(even tibbers is burning) and their lores talk about them using Earth/Light/Fire respectively.

However the only thing that links Syndra and darkness is the color of her skill effects
If her effects were red would she be a fire mage?No of course she wouldn't.

And nothing in Syndras lore talks about manipulating darkness,so there isn't really a reason to believe that she uses dark magic.

And Xerath has telekinetic powers in the lore,but they aren't part of his skillset or core to his character and just because he can do it,doesn't mean we can't have a champ who specializes in this ability,because Xerath can also use fire in the lore,yet we have Brand and Annie in the game.
Meanwhile Syndra uses telekinese in her main lore(letting a castle float,killing her master with a telekinetic push) and it makes up 3 of her 4 active skills(and the last one exists to support the other ones)

> Meanwhile Syndra uses telekinese in her main lore(letting a castle float,killing her master with a telekinetic push) and it makes up 3 of her 4 active skills(and the last one exists to support the other ones)

Lux is also capable of invisibility in the lore.
Yes,she does it by manipulating the light around her,so she is still a full light mage.

Neither pushing people with purple coloured magic is telekinesis, nor manipulating dark spheres through enemies. Only thing I would say that looks telekinetic about Syndra is her W, and even it probably works in way I descripted above,  which is not a direct telekinesis. And floating a castle is something I imagine as a colossus W skill of her. I don't know about you tho.

As I said, if unleashing spheres through enemies is telekinesis, then using fireballs is also telekinesis.

If she is not a dark magic user, I would never call her a telekinesis mage either.

Of course pushing people falls under telekinesis as well.
Telekinesis is the ability to move things around through psychic/magic powers.
So pushing someone with magic is a form of telekinesis.(she also used something like this in the lore,when she killed her mentor,as she slammed him against the wall)
https://vignette1.wikia.nocookie.net/powerlisting/images/f/fd/Force-push-o.gif/revision/latest?cb=20131122175830


And what makes Syndras ult something related to telekinesis is that we know that she moves her orbs with telekinesis,because her W does exactly that(and it even talks about using telekinetic powers)
So  her ult is basically just a more extreme version of her W.


Overall I'd like to know what would you'd expect from a telekinesis mage?
I would expect a telekinesis mage to be able to to hold opponents,throw them,knock them away and to hurl objects at them.
Which is exactly what Syndra does.

I would expect having no dark spheres and other stuffs from a telekinesis mage.

A full telekinesis mage would make it without notice. Like there wouldn't be purple energy around of an item when she uses her powers.

Yoda's force is exactly what I'm talking about. If Yoda used a purple light in there, I wouldn't say It is telekinesis. Syndra would use a sphere, or waves made of ''dark magic'' to push Darth Sidious.

It means she uses her purple/dark/unknown/ magic to manipulate materials.

So essentially your problem is that her skills have a visual effect that accompanies them and that she can make orbs(which like I said is mostly there so that she always has something to toss at the enemy)

Tbh.I think that the effects are mostly done for clarity reasons and because it gives skins more opportunities.
After all it'd be rather hard to dodge invisible attacks(or really difficult to see if she carries a minion behind her) and would be really lame if she had invisible skill effects,as skins couldn't really change much.

If she did not have dark spheres, they wouldn't even exist in her splash art and login screen animation.

I don't think It is because of clarity.

Of course she has dark spheres and even her magic is depicted as purple energy.
I'm just saying that the reason why they decided to give her these effects is because of gameplay reasons.

I'm not saying you're wrong but we can't be sure about that. :p

May be it is, may be it is not. But still, Syndra's primary power comes from her spheres. Spheres are identity of her magic. Telekinesis can only be his secondary power.

I still like the thought/theory that Syndras power is actully manipulating gravity. Telekinsesis has a lot of similiarities, but isn't exactly the same thing.

Considere this: Maybe your idea isn't that good?
We already got a dual-realase with our love birds, so another dual-realase won't happen in near future.
As well we have a lot of elemenatlist mage and spirits, so their are other tropes to cover. 
The Kayle and Morgana Dual-VGU could go for the light/dark thematic, however I hope Riot keeps their old lore in mind and focus more on the order vs freedom aspect. And even this confirmed VGUs won't happen in near future.
We shouldn't forget that their still big parts of the Lore aren't up-to-date as for Noxus (hopefully with the Urgot VGU), Ionia, Bandle City, Void and Freljord could need a touch-up too. Bilgewater and Shurima felt unfinished as well.
Riot is currently trying to combine Champion realases and VGU with world-building/lore updates (see Xayah and Rakan - Vastaya Introducition, Galio VGU - Demacia Update, Piltover and Zhaun Lore Update with WW VGU and Camille...).
Also, even if I don't like every lore update (Targon lore is still BS), in this and last year the got some well-written stories as well with [The Weakest Heart](http://universe.leagueoflegends.com/en_GB/story/camille-weakest-heart/) and[ For Demacia](http://universe.leagueoflegends.com/en_GB/story/for-demacia/) as examples.

TL;DR: Other region/world-building as whole is more important rn, and the idea itself is just boring and generic.
